sub_title: Market operator | Environmental Engineer | Climate and Biodiversity Change | Sustainable Development (UN Goals)
summary:
Since a kid, I was sure that computers and earth are strange and have some harmonic similarities. When I was 18, I thought of doing computer engineering. It was a marvelous tour in my life where I get to understand machines and learn their languages. I felt like a superhero, I felt that I understood Alan Turing more deeply now.

When I was 23 I got my first job as a MySQL software developer and could talk to machines but the earth did not seem happy. It was dirty and resources are fading. While visiting nearby villages for company-sponsored social work, I saw what beauty this planet holds and how are we ruining it.

 I was determined to pursue my currier in Environment engineering. It took me 10,000 self-talking sessions to gain courage and move forward, but despite mental fatigue, I knew my calling. Once I say I’ll do something, it will happen.

Now, I put that awareness and knowledge to work as an Environment Engineer and Sustainability Data Engineer for firms. I don’t have to climb any mountains…but I do have to move them. I’m well-versed in my computer department with proficiency in java, c, python, machine learning, and data engineering. Apart from technical skills, I am also acquainted with planning and relationship management.

I have work experience of 3 years in the software and sustainable development industry and I have learned various new skills.
If I seem enough interesting from my profile, I would love to grab a coffee and talk about the future in your company, please send an email my way.

Competencies: Data Engineering, Weather Database Managment, LEED, BREEM, Microsoft Office, Wastewater Treatment, Water Treatment, Water chemistry and microbiology, Sustainability, Sustainable Development Goals,  Java, Python, C, Mysql, Management, Net Zero Carbon, Carbon footprint

profile_positions.description:
•	Data Visualization Specialist in a multidisciplinary and multicultural team of 5 people, justifying ‘Urban Heat Island Effect’ based on weather data of past 10 years and air-cooling systems from KMNI, Meet Je Stad, Wu Underground, and Energy Sectors by developing Conceptual ER Modelling and tools for data visualization 
•	Researched on the possibility of cloud infrastructure of different temperature data sets on geodesign platform ‘Tygron’ for better predictive analysis of changing temperatures 
•	Presented the results and possibility of revamping Tygron with Clustering Distributed systems instead of Mainframe for accurate data collection to stakeholders and team’s head with a guidebook as deliverable detailing strategy and policies to mitigate heating of cities through Stakeholder’ map
•	Accurate analysis of ‘Heat stress modelling’ and ‘Urban heat island effect’ using the ideations of design thinking and software development
•	Revamped the geodesign Digital Twin platform ‘Tygron’ with new analyzed data
•	Justified hypothesis of temperature differences between weather sensors inside and outside the urban area
•	Advice policymakers in Amersfoort Municipality to plan the city as per SDG 11 – Sustainable and Innovative cities
•	Maintaining partnerships and evolving current relations with industry companies and associates
•	Analyzing UN Sustainable development Goals (SDG 13, SDG 11, and SDG 3) for project ‘Heat Resistant City’ and tackling night-time heat dynamics of the city
•	Creating awareness among the common public against urban heat island effect and night-time heat and its adverse effects on human health with Storytelling

•     Working towards Sustainable Development Goal 4 - Quality Education and enhancing the basic education among different classes of children (different ethnicity, financial background, interests). The idea was to make children believe to pursue their interests apart from traditional Indian white-collar jobs
•   Quality education  without any biases for a better and sustainable future

profile_positions.description:
•	Implemented SQL scripts to lower the number of tickets coming into Backoffice database system by 60% and liaised transparent relationship among departments by deploying scripts (data migration) in different instances (development, test, and production) using Azure to mitigate ongoing issues and achieved 50% reduction in ticket SLA (Azure Reporting).
•	Responsible for developing Logical ER Modelling for B2B interactions for clear divulgence of data exchange between businesses via various virtual interactive team meetings using butter application, teams, and Microsoft office
•	Worked in a diverse multidisciplinary team of Oracle Functional department for automating data pipelines for better data visualization and reporting of tickets count along with integrating ideas of Databases and Cloud Architecture in every agile development sprints
•	Integrated learnings into SQL scripts between Contract termination (QTT) and Inquiry to funds (ITR) process
•	Data Analysis of recurring issues and programmed script for similar contract termination issues
•	Maintained clear communication between clients and backend office to provide correct and on point issue analysis
•	Volunteer for improving living standards of orphanages, to achieve SDG 3(Good health) and SDG 10(Reduced Inequality) in rural Bangalore
•	Proposed SDG 5 (Gender Equality) in team space
profile_positions.title: Associate Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Worked as Sustainability Intern in AIESEC to understand the ground-level circumstances in India causing gender inequality and inequality among different educational organizations. The points that I worked on are:-

How does education in fancy private English schools differ from local government schools?
How differently-abled children are treated in educational areas?
Do women have a say when it comes to decision-making even though they have received basic education as compared to the men of the educational faulty?
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Intern

volunteer_experiences.description:
It is true that India is a land of diversity and old civilization but we often forget that diversity and principles are not just defined by different cultural groups but within households as grandparents. 

I was sitting in my class on a hot summer day. It was as usual a lethargic class. My eyes caught an old tribal lady sitting under a tree. It was quite clear that she was parched. When I had my break I went to her to offer water, with teary eyes she recalled her home where she had well in her house. She was thrown out of her house by her son and daughter-in-law, as she seems to occupy unnecessary space which could be given to her grandchildren.

From that moment, I was determined to do something in my capacity for elderly people. Through the service of Helpage India, I organized a campaign in my locality. I raised a fund of 5000 INR, which was appreciable amount at that time. I got recognition from my teachers for my social work.

India with growth in its industrialization, it is evident that she is steeping her foot in every aspect of product manufacturing.  This forced excess plastic production. My role was to lead a campaign into the villages and make them aware of current plastic pollution and encourage them to use earthern pots for storing water. 

This way the purpose is also filled of storing water and is more sustainable method. We visited 5 nearby villages and encouraged local potters to increase their business and provide them in every homes.
If animals are not safe and happy, the society cannot be defined as thriving. The aim was to save maximum dogs and report them so that they can have health care and can go to adoption centers.

skills: Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design (LEED)
